title: Adhesive Capsulitis Management
content: Adhesive capsulitis (frozen shoulder) involves painful restriction of shoulder movement due to capsular inflammation and fibrosis. Treatment progresses through phases: pain control with NSAIDs and gentle stretching during the freezing phase; more aggressive stretching and mobilization during the frozen stage; and strengthening exercises during the thawing phase. Corticosteroid injections may accelerate recovery in early stages.
